name: Radisson Blu Royal Hotel, Helsinki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed four nights in August, one on arrival on the 8th of Aug and another three before our departure on the 18th. first night stay we got a slightly older room on the 6th floor. i say older because the electronics/lighting in the room worked without using the door keycard - just had a simple on/off switch...how quaint in this day & age. also the carpet in the room smelled a bit old and the exterior of the door was scratched quite badly - looked like an itinerant kid had keyed the paint.
reviews.title: Ask for a carpet free room!

reviews.text: on the last leg of our trip i asked for a 'nordic' room which just means one without carpeting and potentially allergy free. much nicer room, newer, on 3rd floor, no strange smells with keycard slot to operate lighting.
reviews.title: A Good Hotel

reviews.text: buffet breakfast outstanding with soya milk available on request (finally!). breakfast finishes at 10 on weekdays but staff aren't sniffy about people rocking up to eat at 9:45...unlike many french hotels i've stayed in - they'll let you find a seat, grab a croissant & coffee and proceed to hover over your table forcibly removing your plate and cup before you've finished chewing your last bite or swallowed your last gulp.
reviews.title: Great accomodation for new years eve

aka: Radisson Blu Royal Hotel, Helsinki Hotel
description: Sleek Business-oriented Hotel with striking glass facade & atrium.
